intro: Crotalaria mandrarensis, commonly known as the Madagascar crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of its native habitat. Crotalaria mandrarensis is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its uses.
